result.execSummary:
The defendant Dillon J Votis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Must be paid with the first 60 days of probation

The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

The defendant may not possess/consume any alcohol. 

The defendant may not enter any bars/taverns.
Court will grant expunction under 973.015 but is not automatic - defendant must petition the court.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.
Must be paid within the first 60 days of probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dillon J Votis

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Called 10:09 AM. Dillon Votis appears in person and with counsel Tim Drewa. State appears by Charles Simono. State - resolved - amend count #1 to misd bail jumping contrary to 946.49(1)(a) - plead G to amended count - withhold sentence and place on probation for 12 months with conditions of: $300 fine plus costs totalling $831.00, AODA and follow thru, absolute sobriety, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any class B establishment, employment/school, 100 hours of community service. Drewa and Votis agree. Court amends only count #1 to misd bail jumping contrary to 946.49(1)(a) - reads new penalties. Votis pleads G. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State - follow joint recommendation - no objections to request for expunction. Drewa - follow joint recommendations - request expunction. Votis makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: withhold sentence and place on probation for 1 year with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, maintain/obtain full time employment/school with verbage, 100 hours of community service, $300 fine plus costs totalling $831.00 - paid within first 60 days of probation, will grant expunction under 973.015 but it is not automatic - he must petition the court, right to appeal, adjourned.
Final pre-trial on September 17, 2014 at 10:15 am.
Final pre-trial on September 17, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Called 5:25 pm. Dillon Votis appears in person with counsel Tim Drewa. State by Charles Simono. Has complaint waives reading - also provides court with WOPH - court goes thru waiver and finds that defendant is waiving right to PH freely, voluntarily and intelligently - accepts waiver, finds probable cause and binds over. State will file information tomorrow which will mirror complaint. Drewa pleads NG on behalf of his client. Court accepts plea and will set for FPT 9/17/14 @ 1:15 pm. Drewa asks for bond to be modified to sig bond. State no objection to signature however, wants no consumption to conditions. Drewa no objection. Court modifies bond to $2000 sig bond with no consumption of alcohol. Power was out therefore, bond to attorney Drewa and he will have his client sign and return to Clerk within 10 days.
